meanings.definition: To decorate with leaves or leaf-like motifs.
meanings.sent1: She decided to foliate the walls of her room with beautiful leaf patterns.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a stencil to foliate the border of the painting with intricate leaf designs.
meanings.sent3: The party planner chose to foliate the party invitations with playful leaf illustrations.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no bounds as she managed to foliate even the smallest details of the room.
meanings.sent5: The garden was transformed into a magical wonderland as she began to foliate every corner with lush greenery.

meanings.sent1: The foliate tree provided a cool shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: The ancient manuscript was adorned with intricate foliate patterns along the margins.
meanings.sent3: The foliate crown on the statue made it look regal and majestic.
meanings.sent4: The foliate design on the antique mirror added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent5: The foliate border on the dress gave it a natural and graceful appearance.

meanings.sent1: In spring, the trees begin to foliate, covering the branches with fresh green leaves.
meanings.sent2: The plant seemed to foliate overnight, surprising the gardener with its rapid growth.
meanings.sent3: The gardeners eagerly awaited the moment when the bare branches would foliate once again.
meanings.sent4: As the season changed, the trees started to foliate, signaling the arrival of summer.
meanings.sent5: The barren landscape slowly transformed as the trees began to foliate, bringing life back to the surroundings.
